ThingDef.label: Leather Pants
ThingDef.description: These are a pair of leather pants (sometimes even real leather!). The punk wearing these will always feel lucky.

ThingDef.label: Loincloth
ThingDef.description: A tribal loincloth. It covers parts of you, sort of.

ThingDef.label: Jeans
ThingDef.description: Sturdy farmer pants.

ThingDef.label: Stablehand Trousers
ThingDef.description: Ain't a chap on earf lookin' as honest as one wearin' these. With these equipped one should feel more comfortable wading through mud and filth and therefore more inclined to get the job done without distractions.

ThingDef.label: Suspender Pants
ThingDef.description: A simple set of pants with suspenders that drape over the shoulders to hold the pants up.

ThingDef.label: Armored Pants
ThingDef.description: A pair of pants, reinforced with armor.

ThingDef.label: Fancy Pants
ThingDef.description: Fancy Pants are for elegant colonists. Your legs will be the star of the show!

ThingDef.label: Patched Pants
ThingDef.description: A crude set of pants for use in emergencies.

ThingDef.label: Holstered Chaps
ThingDef.description: A pair of chaps with holsters. All of the fastest shooters wore these. They usually got shot in the back. (Can be worn over other pants).

ThingDef.label: Constructor's Trousers
ThingDef.description: Trousers with huge pocket space.

ThingDef.label: Camo Military Pants
ThingDef.description: Standard military camouflage pants of USCM troopers.

ThingDef.label: Marine Military Pants
ThingDef.description: Reliable military pants intended for marines.

ThingDef.label: Space Marine Leggings
ThingDef.description: A pair of leggings covered in a thin layer of kevlar. Can be worn over most of the other pants.

ThingDef.label: Cryptonaut Pants
ThingDef.description: An armored set of pants designed for ultimate balance.

ThingDef.label: Tribal Wear
ThingDef.description: A garment crafted without machines using neolithic tools.

ThingDef.label: Oven Mitts
ThingDef.description: A pair of heat resistant oven mitts for cooks.

ThingDef.label: Leather Gloves
ThingDef.description: A pair of hardened leather gloves, commonly used by most craftsmen.

ThingDef.label: Reinforced Gloves
ThingDef.description: Tyke Bison allegedly hid one of these under his boxing glove during a match. Luckily not a single blow was exchanged before Tyke had already bitten his opponent's nose off. The hit with the powered glove could of killed the poor man.

ThingDef.label: Leather Grips
ThingDef.description: Fingerless leather gloves with real steady, gripping abilities. (Worn on both hands, 1st layer)

ThingDef.label: Stabilizer Gloves
ThingDef.description: The antiswerve-adjustor installed in these gloves has made it a particular favorite of snipers.

ThingDef.label: Soothing Gloves
ThingDef.description: Basic leather gloves rigged up with an intricate injection device with beautiful purple liquid inside. Soothes your nerves and lets you act in stressful situations.

ThingDef.label: Doctor's Cutters
ThingDef.description: Rubbery and clinical. It has very sharp scissors strapped on it. What could possibly go wrong?

ThingDef.label: Doctor's Pincers
ThingDef.description: Rubbery and clinical. It has very claspy pincers strapped on it.

ThingDef.label: Discharger Gloves
ThingDef.description: The microscopic exoskeleton in the gloves gives the wearer a quick and steady grip when squeezing the trigger.

ThingDef.label: Calmax Gloves
ThingDef.description: Basic leather gloves rigged up with an intricate injection device with glowing green liquid inside. Calms your nerves and lets you act in stressful situations.

ThingDef.label: Power Gloves
ThingDef.description: When you need your melee strikes to hit harder, you wear a pair of hex-cell fueled power gloves.

ThingDef.label: Clawed Boots
ThingDef.description: Boots with claws on them. They give a steady grip on rough terrain. (Worn on feet, 3rd layer)

ThingDef.label: Shoes
ThingDef.description: Very basic shoes. Helps with moving through terrain. (Worn on feet, 3rd layer)

ThingDef.label: Metal Boots
ThingDef.description: Metal boots. Ain't nobody stepping on your toes now! (Worn on feet, 3rd layer)

ThingDef.label: Snow Boots
ThingDef.description: Boots designed for cold snow. They are exceptionally warm and comfy. (Worn on feet, 3rd layer)

ThingDef.label: Fur Boots
ThingDef.description: Very furry and warm boots. They can help with moving through terrain. (Worn on feet, 3rd layer)

ThingDef.label: Spurred Boots
ThingDef.description: Leather boots with spurs. The spurs help with moving through terrain. (Worn on feet, 3rd layer)

ThingDef.label: Cryptonaut Springers
ThingDef.description: A pair of footwear designed for ultimate balance. Stride through the environment like a rabbit on dope. (Worn on feet, 3rd layer)

ThingDef.label: Pirate Eyepatch
ThingDef.description: An eyepatch to cover an eye. Makes you look like a real pirate, yarr har!

ThingDef.label: Scarf
ThingDef.description: A scarf is a long piece of fabric wrapped around the neck. It is commonly used in cold regions as it provides protection from cold weather.

ThingDef.label: mask
ThingDef.description: A simple hankerkief mask. Commonly worn by bandits.

ThingDef.label: Sunshades
ThingDef.description: A pair of stylish eye shades favoured for protection from the sun. The wearer will never get caught with the excuse "the sun was shining in my eyes!"

ThingDef.label: Camo Scarf
ThingDef.description: A special scout type scarf with a military camouflage pattern. It provides some protection from cold.

ThingDef.label: Goggled Ski Mask
ThingDef.description: A military grade mask with skiing goggles attached, with a slightly stylized design. It is known for its heavy impact resistance.

ThingDef.label: Marine Storm Mask
ThingDef.description: A mask with a of pair of marine special forces military grade goggles, slightly stylized design. It is known for having heavy impact resistance.

ThingDef.label: Shuttle Pilot's Visor
ThingDef.description: A pair of shuttle pilot's visors. It can be used to fulfill your usual piloting needs like calling in "Houston; mayday mayday - landing struts are jammed, I repeat landing struts are jammed. Copy? Roger Wilco. Starfox One out."

ThingDef.label: Padded Vest
ThingDef.description: A vest with crude leather padding for added protection against blunt damage.

ThingDef.label: Brocade Vest
ThingDef.description: To always keep calm and collected, wear a brocade vest. The definite go to piece of apparel for any gentleguy or gal.

ThingDef.label: Hauberk
ThingDef.description: A long coat of interlocking metal rings, which provides good protection from slicing attacks.

ThingDef.label: Armored Vestplate
ThingDef.description: A vest with armor plates inserted on the chest and back. Protects against gunfire.

ThingDef.label: Tactical Vestplate
ThingDef.description: A vest with armor plates inserted on the chest and back. Protects against gunfire.

ThingDef.label: Marine Vestplate
ThingDef.description: A military vest with armor plates inserted on the chest and back. Protects against gunfire.

ThingDef.label: Alloy Vest
ThingDef.description: Standard issue protective vest on the glitterworlds. Made of multiple layers of extremely light but strong alloy.

ThingDef.label: Loadbearing Kit
ThingDef.description: A loadbearing vest with a number of pouches to store magazines and other equipment.\n\nSpeeds up reloading but is quite bulky to wear.

ThingDef.label: Backpack
ThingDef.description: A comfortable and spacious backpack for storing all kinds of items.

ThingDef.label: Mundane Shirt
ThingDef.description: A very mundane shirt. Slightly warmer than most base clothing.

ThingDef.label: Gambeson
ThingDef.description: Also known as an aketon, padded jack, or arming doublet, this padded defensive jacket provides decent protection. It is meant to be paired with a mail hauberk or plate armor.

ThingDef.label: T-Shirt
ThingDef.description: A simple piece of clothing worn on the body with short sleeves.

ThingDef.label: Button-down Shirt
ThingDef.description: A nice looking collared shirt with buttons in front.

ThingDef.label: Urban Shirt
ThingDef.description: All the punks felt lucky wearing these.

ThingDef.label: Marine Shirt
ThingDef.description: A basic military T-shirt intended for marines.

ThingDef.label: Camo Ghillie Suit
ThingDef.description: A scout's camouflaged ghillie suit. You can blend in with bushes and grasses if you wanted to do so.

ThingDef.label: Air Force Overalls
ThingDef.description: Standard military issue air force overalls. Very common amongst orbital drop squads.

ThingDef.label: X-Com Overalls
ThingDef.description: Spaceship engineers all across the galaxy are known to wear these for the resistance they provide; against their worst enemy...electric cables.

ThingDef.label: Jumpsuit
ThingDef.description: A basic heat absorbing jumpsuit. Normally seen worn on Glitterworld light infantry, officials and firefighters.

ThingDef.label: Cryptopod Bodysuit
ThingDef.description: This is the kind of full body suit that you see worn on occasion by long distance travelers.

ThingDef.label: Cryptosleep Bodysuit
ThingDef.description: A full body suit designed for extended cryptosleep. You can rest easy knowing your body won't be naked for hundreds or thousands of years while you sleep.

ThingDef.label: Tunic
ThingDef.description: A very sleek and skillfully crafted full body suit capable of protecting the wearer from formidable threats.

ThingDef.label: Marine Bodysuit
ThingDef.description: A pair of green military overalls intended for marines.

ThingDef.label: Carbon Overalls
ThingDef.description: High tech overalls with carbon fibers woven in. Provides good protection.

ThingDef.label: Fur Coat
ThingDef.description: A furry long cape. Really warm.

ThingDef.label: Raider Jacket
ThingDef.description: A basic jacket modified with crude shoulderpads and spikes.

ThingDef.label: Jacket
ThingDef.description: A tough jacket to stop scrapes and bruises, and to keep one warm in chilly weather.

ThingDef.label: Parka
ThingDef.description: A thick parka for staying warm in the coldest of temperatures.

ThingDef.label: Quilted Jacket
ThingDef.description: A quilted jacket for staying warm in the coldest of temperatures.

ThingDef.label: Duster
ThingDef.description: A long duster coat for blocking the sun and grit of the desert.

ThingDef.label: Blazer
ThingDef.description: A more casual approach to a suit jacket, blazers are often worn as a formal uniform.

ThingDef.label: Poncho
ThingDef.description: A gunslinger's second best friend, right after the six shooter and Ten-Gallon Stetson! No, wait make that the third best friend.

ThingDef.label: Marine Suit
ThingDef.description: A fancy suit jacket that can be worn on top of a shirt. You can look your best at any time of the day in a suit!

ThingDef.label: Skynet Cloak
ThingDef.description: A high tech Skynet cloak, often worn by terminators.

ThingDef.label: Light Power Armor
ThingDef.description: Powered light armor fashioned after the infamous light power armor mark IV. It comes attached with GlitOrion hip'n'hop thrusters, which enables slightly faster movement.

ThingDef.label: Doctor's Brocade
ThingDef.description: To always keep calm and collected, wear brocade. The definite go to piece of apparel for any gentleguy or gal, now in doctor's edition. All of the doctors wearing these know how to talk to their patients or at the very least give the impression that they'd know what the heck they are doing.

ThingDef.label: Scout Armor
ThingDef.description: A set of light armor used by military scouts. Intended to provide some protection without hindering movement.

ThingDef.label: Medium Power Armor
ThingDef.description: Powered medium armor, designed for light infantry and support units. It is less famous and bulkier than light power armor. It comes attached with GlitOrion hip'n'hop thrusters, which enables slightly faster movement.

ThingDef.label: Syndicate Coat
ThingDef.description: A long coat with bulletproof alloy breastplate. Modern technology full of grit.

ThingDef.label: hemical Protection Suit
ThingDef.description: A Chemical Protection Suit (also known as a hazmat suit) can protect people from hazardous materials or substances including chemicals, biological agents, or radioactive materials.

ThingDef.label: Plate Armor
ThingDef.description: This heavy armor made of metal plates provides good protection from all sorts of attacks, but at the cost of slowing the wearer down, and it can be uncomfortable in hot climates.

ThingDef.label: Marine Ghillie Overalls
ThingDef.description: Full body camouflage for special forces in the field.

ThingDef.label: Marine Personal Armor
ThingDef.description: Standard issue military body armor for Colonial Marines.

ThingDef.label: Phase Armor
ThingDef.description: Reinforced medium armor for uncommon operations.

ThingDef.label: Phase Jet Armor
ThingDef.description: Reinforced medium armor with jetpack.

ThingDef.label: Hive Armor
ThingDef.description: Armor that is fashioned after the centipede body structure. This extremely bulky armor is nigh indestructable. The sheer weight of this piece of armor drastically hinders mobility.

ThingDef.label: Steamhull
ThingDef.description: A combination of mobility enhancing components of the Scyther frame and heavy plating of the Hive armor. The increased energy consumption from the added scyther frame servos have forced the shock dampeners to work on lesser capacity, thus rendering the wearer more vulnerable to injuries but the higher mobility under combat situations is well worth it. It generates absurd amounts of heat though.

ThingDef.label: Power Armor
ThingDef.description: An advanced suit of armor powered by uranium. It is usually used by assault troops from advanced glitterworld planets.

ThingDef.label: Interactor Cloak
ThingDef.description: A special interactor cloak. Provides good insulation from heat and cold.

ThingDef.label: Siege Armor
ThingDef.description: This is a set of JE-342A7 "Dvergr (Dwarf)" siege armor, minus the helmet. Like many other fort-world corporation products, Dvergr siege armor has a single main purpose. In this case, the main purpose is the survival of the wearer at any cost.

ThingDef.label: Close Combat Armor
ThingDef.description: The JE-257A1 "Einherjar" close combat armor is a modified version of "Dvergr" siege armor. Some of the thick armor plates have been removed so that high powered actuators and fast recharging shields could be installed.

ThingDef.label: Mining Helmet
ThingDef.description: A miner's best friend. This hard hat will help protect you when the roof comes crashing down. The built in light is also reassuring when alone in dark caves.

ThingDef.label: Tusk Head Garment
ThingDef.description: A head piece that was lovingly crafted out of tusk. You can almost feel the spirit of this slumbering beast within you.

ThingDef.label: Horned Head Garment
ThingDef.description: Lovingly crafted out of sturdiest horned head garment. You can almost feel the spirit of this brave animal beast within you. It's very warm and horny.

ThingDef.label: Thick Leather Head Garment
ThingDef.description: A head piece that was lovingly crafted out of thick leather. You can almost feel the spirit of this determined beast within you.

ThingDef.label: Ram Head Garment
ThingDef.description: A head piece that was lovingly crafted out of enduring Rimram hide. You can almost feel the spirit of this stubborn beast within you.

ThingDef.label: Chitin Head Garment
ThingDef.description: A head piece that was lovingly crafted out of shiny chitin. You can almost feel the spirit of this intelligent beast within you.

ThingDef.label: Feathered Headdress
ThingDef.description: This feathered headdress offers little in the way of protection, however anyone who wears it feels the spirit of the warrior stirring from deep within.

ThingDef.label: Shimmering Crown
ThingDef.description: An awe inspiring crown. It makes your subject's hearts beat ever so faster around you.

ThingDef.label: Morion
ThingDef.description: A basic metal helmet with a flat ridge in the middle, worthy of a Spanish conquistador. It keeps your head safe from blows sometimes, if you're lucky.

ThingDef.label: Kettlehat
ThingDef.description: A helmet with a large metal brim for extra protection; favored by peasant but seen as unfit for nobility.

ThingDef.label: Nasal Helmet
ThingDef.description: A simple helmet with a slight innovation: a bar that extended down over the nose, provding better protection to the face but somewhat obscuring vision.

ThingDef.label: Horned Cap
ThingDef.description: A decorated, hardened leather cap. Often worn by the most revered and skilled combatants of Norbal communities.

ThingDef.label: Fur Hat
ThingDef.description: To keep your head warm in cold climates, wear fur! Be warned though that in the right place, the fur wears you!

ThingDef.label: Woollen Cap
ThingDef.description: A woollen cap made from very woollen material. Nothing can compete with it in keeping your head warm. The tuft on top keeps your nerves cold!

ThingDef.label: Baseball Cap
ThingDef.description: A common cap. Perhaps most famous from the age old game where you hit a ball with a stick-like bat and then run home.

ThingDef.label: Bandana
ThingDef.description: A rather simple piece of cloth worn on the head. It covers your hair.

ThingDef.label: Fancy Bandana
ThingDef.description: This bandana is little more than a fancy piece of cloth that is worn on the head. It covers your hair.

ThingDef.label: Fedora
ThingDef.description: Nah, see! These hats are often associated with gangsters and government officials, which are both practically the same.

ThingDef.label: Captain's Tricorne
ThingDef.description: A three-pointed hat with a captain's insignia on it. You're the captain now.

ThingDef.label: Warm Cap
ThingDef.description: A simple cap. It helps to keep your head warm. It seems a bit small and doesn't quite cover your entire head.

ThingDef.label: Vandal's Cap and Scarf
ThingDef.description: Your common cap with a scarf. Urbworld Crims would often don these on while robbing the local corner store. These kind of criminals are famous for their itchy trigger fingers, poor aim, brick throwing and trashcan kicking shenanigans.

ThingDef.label: Duellist's Hat
ThingDef.description: A well decorated, brimmed hat. A cowboy would want this.

ThingDef.label: Kufiya
ThingDef.description: A kufiya is a type of square scarf often wrapped around the face and neck. It is commonly used in arid regions as it provides protection from sunburn, dust and sand.

ThingDef.label: Bicorne
ThingDef.description: An awe inspiring hat. Similar to that of a king with a crown, only captains who have a bicorne are acknowledged as the real deal.

ThingDef.label: Hard Hat
ThingDef.description: Favoured by the construction workers all across the galaxy. These are known to have saved lives of many who fell prey to the infamous falling lunchbox, hammer or brick.

ThingDef.label: Chef's Hat
ThingDef.description: These iconic chef hats do serve an actual purpose - keeping the hair in check. Finding hair in your soup often means dissatisfied customer.

ThingDef.label: Peaked Cap
ThingDef.description: Often seen on military officers, these indigenous alpha mammals of the battlefields tend to be so amazing that their skills rub off on their clothes.

ThingDef.label: Tricorn
ThingDef.description: The tricorn is long out of fashion. Why anyone would still wear these is strange. Still, they are comfortable to wear.

ThingDef.label: Sombrero
ThingDef.description: Keeps the sun off your eyes during siesta! Ay caramba!

ThingDef.label: Medic's Bandana
ThingDef.description: A medic's bandana. It is used to easily point out medics in a crowd.

ThingDef.label: Headset with Bandana
ThingDef.description: Common usage for these has been in communication. It is wireless and doesn't work, but it gives the impression that you're somehow more social!

ThingDef.label: Beret
ThingDef.description: A soft and warm military cap. It is very common amongst off-duty soldiers. Uniforms with berets commonly inspire respect.

ThingDef.label: Cardshark Hat
ThingDef.description: Stylish, elegant and soft to the touch. Known as the most important part of western attire, especially amongst the card cheats and other slippery individuals.

ThingDef.label: Russian Winter Hat
ThingDef.description: A Russian winter hat with ear flaps. It can keep your head warm during the coldest of winters.

ThingDef.label: Winter Cap
ThingDef.description: A snug, fitted winter-worthy cap to keep your head warm in the harsh cold.

ThingDef.label: Military Helmet
ThingDef.description: An old-looking, heavy, but effective military helmet. Protects against low-velocity projectiles, shrapnel, falling debris and cuts to the head.

ThingDef.label: Kevlar Helmet
ThingDef.description: A lightweight armored combat helmet that protects your head and ears.

ThingDef.label: Marine Ballistic Helmet
ThingDef.description: A marine helmet designed to protect against ballistics. This is a standard issue item for Colonial Marines.

ThingDef.label: Ghillie Hood
ThingDef.description: A camouflaged hood worn by members of the special forces. It pairs up with the ghillie suit.

ThingDef.label: Scout Helmet
ThingDef.description: This basic scout helmet doesn't offer great protection, but it is lightweight.

ThingDef.label: Camo Ballistic Helmet
ThingDef.description: A camouflaged version of the marine ballistic helmet. It is a standard issue item for Colonial Marines.

ThingDef.label: Military Googled Helmet
ThingDef.description: A camouflaged marine ballistic helmet with built in goggles. This is a standard issue item for Colonial Marines.

ThingDef.label: Military Pilot Helmet
ThingDef.description: A standard issue helmet used by pilots across all of the USCM fleets.

ThingDef.label: Tactical Helmet
ThingDef.description: A tactical combat helmet used by special forces.

ThingDef.label: Security Bandana
ThingDef.description: A special security bandana to show how tough you are.

ThingDef.label: Medic's Kevlar Helmet
ThingDef.description: An essential part of personal armor for combat medics. It can help to absorb the explosion of a grenade.

ThingDef.label: Clan Marked Balaclava
ThingDef.description: Without proper methods of finding out, you'll be forever uncertain whether this balaclava is the real deal or not. The marking on the forehead strongly suggests it indeed is a remnant of an ancient clan of fighters.

ThingDef.label: Marine Tactical Mask
ThingDef.description: A marine special forces black tactical mask. Also known as balaclava.

ThingDef.label: Psychic Foil Helmet
ThingDef.description: A thin helmet containing finely-tuned sheets of psychically-absorptive foil. Reduces the impact of psychic events.

ThingDef.label: Joywirer's Cap
ThingDef.description: Hardened leather and snazzy goggles. It is almost as if you could pilot your way through someone's psyche with this cap equipped!

ThingDef.label: War Engineer's Comm-Link
ThingDef.description: Often referred to as Redcaps, the war-engineers were in charge of keeping the supply lines up and running. The are stories of one heroic forward scout war-engineer crashlanding on a Tunnelworld during a war in the local star system. Said engineer eventually escaped the planet after somehow managing to activate a nuclear device in the planet's core, which left the planet uninhabitable. It is not known whether his tale of the Tunnelworld being under dictatorship of a powerhungry scientist was true or not. The ramblings about speedrunning through hell with his girlfriend on tow was big blow on his credibility. The only truth in whole story is that the Tunnelworld did indeed blow up!

ThingDef.label: Shuttle Pilot Helm
ThingDef.description: All the famous shuttle pilots wore one of these, some were more adorned than others. This is one of the more practical and basic ones.

ThingDef.label: Interactor Hood
ThingDef.description: An interactor hood to pair with the interactor cloak.

ThingDef.label: hemical Protection Helmet
ThingDef.description: A part of a Chemical Protection Suit (also known as a hazmat suit). It helps to protect people from hazardous materials or substances including chemicals, biological agents, or radioactive materials.

ThingDef.label: Human Skull
ThingDef.description: A partial mask crafted out of a human's skull. There is something very unsettling about it.

ThingDef.label: Fur Head Garment
ThingDef.description: A head piece that was lovingly crafted out of nimble furxhide. You can almost feel the spirit of this cunning beast within you.

ThingDef.label: Welding Helmet
ThingDef.description: A welding helmet is a type of head gear that is used when performing certain types of welding to protect the eyes, face and neck from flash burn, ultraviolet light, sparks, infrared light, and heat.

ThingDef.label: Voodoo Hat
ThingDef.description: A hat shrouded with mystery. Sometimes it contains bunnies, paychecks, oranges or various other loot.

ThingDef.label: Cowl
ThingDef.description: A hardened leather cowl. Often worn by the sages of the Norbal communities.

ThingDef.label: Skull Cap
ThingDef.description: An adorned cap that protects the entire head.

ThingDef.label: Winged Skullcap
ThingDef.description: An adorned cap that protects the entire head, now with wings attached!

ThingDef.label: Bascinet
ThingDef.description: A bascinet is a warrior's helmet that protects the entire head.

ThingDef.label: Armet
ThingDef.description: This medieval full-head helmet improves upon the great helm by including a visor which can be lifted when outside of combat.

ThingDef.label: Topfhelm
ThingDef.description: A helmet that covers the full head and provides good protection, but it hinders sight and is uncomfortable to wear.

ThingDef.label: Bandit Hat and Scarf
ThingDef.description: Stylish, elegant and soft to the touch. Known as the most important part of western attire, sspecially amongst the card cheats and other slippery individuals. It comes with a scarf for added banditry.

ThingDef.label: Tinkercraft Chef Hat
ThingDef.description: A hat armed with timers and very basic scent detectors to help anyone cook their meals just right. The chef hat on it is just for declaring the purpose of this headgear.

ThingDef.label: Psy Gas Mask
ThingDef.description: The Psy Company's Gasmask has to be their most profiting product of all times. The built in vision sensor technology allows the wearer to operate in the thickest of toxic clouds and more importantly, survive.

ThingDef.label: Surgeon's Headgear
ThingDef.description: When fiddling with someone else's vital organs, sanitary equipment is crucial. Wearing these enhances the doctor's sight with the amplifier modules on the goggles. The surgical mask prevents unwanted bacteria entering the vict...patient.

ThingDef.label: Gasmask
ThingDef.description: As an unwieldy and cumbersome protection from gas attacks, this gasmask is not commonly used anymore due to more advanced, better alternatives. However, it is still favored by raiders for its intimidating look.

ThingDef.label: Elephant Gasmask
ThingDef.description: The 'Lefant Industries' Gasmask (Or the "Elephant Mask" as it is more commonly known as) was heavily used by the most military outfits, until one very fatal design flaw was found. The air filters would get caught in closing elevator hatches and ladder steps or rungs while descending.

ThingDef.label: Hooded Elephant Gasmask
ThingDef.description: The 'Lefant Industries' Gasmask (Or the "Elephant Mask" as it is more commonly known as) was heavily used by the most military outfits, until one very fatal design flaw was found. The air filters would get caught in closing elevator hatches and ladder steps or rungs while descending. This one is hooded! It is pretty warm.

ThingDef.label: Tac-Team Headcover
ThingDef.description: Designed to be used by tactical squads in urban warfare situations, it comes with a pre-installed velocity booster and built-in aiming assist. It does expose the wearer's brain to minimal and totally acceptable levels of radioactivity, which is okay!

ThingDef.label: Syndicate Hood
ThingDef.description: Ultimate protection from the wind! The kind of headwear you see worn by shady characters in dark alleys, glaring at you, with gleaming eyes, Ready to stab yo... *gurgle*

ThingDef.label: Phase Helmet
ThingDef.description: Helmet of the Phase armor.

ThingDef.label: Phase Jet Helmet
ThingDef.description: Improved Phase Helmet.

ThingDef.label: Siege Armor Helmet
ThingDef.description: This is a helmet of the JE-342A7 "Dvergr (Dwarf)" siege armor. A rugged and trustworthy helmet to protect a soft, fleshy head from even the nastiest of enemies.

ThingDef.label: Close Combat Helmet
ThingDef.description: The JE-257A1 "Einherjar" close combat armor is a modified version of "Dvergr" siege armor. Some of the thick armor plates have been removed so that high powered actuators and fast recharging shields could be installed.

ThingDef.label: PowerMind-Headgear
ThingDef.description: A prototype of a very innovative headgear aimed to enhance synaptic reaction rates. It has some very unsavory side effects such as overbearing nervousness, ringing ears, strange background noises and/or voices.

ThingDef.label: MindBlast-Headgear
ThingDef.description: A very innovative headgear aimed to enhance synaptic reaction rates. It still has some very unsavory side effects although not as bad as before. Placing an advanced AI core on it seemed to work out most of the kinks. Unfortunately, the AI core also amplifies wearer psychic sensitivity, leaving them extremely vulnerable to psychic powers.

ThingDef.label: Antis-Headgear
ThingDef.description: A very curious piece of technology, the final iteration of the prototype. Negates the awkward effects even further.

ThingDef.label: Enviro-Headgear
ThingDef.description: A warm, cozy and most importantly airtight headgear designed for deep-space explorers to combat the hostile bacteria on uninhabitable planets.

ThingDef.label: Hive Helmet
ThingDef.description: Coupled with the Hive armor, the beastly visage of this helmet could very well cause that 'wet trousers' symptom in your foes.

ThingDef.label: Steam Helmet
ThingDef.description: Bulky headgear designed to match the steamhull. For some reason it reminds everyone of a choo choo train, huh.

ThingDef.label: Light Power Armor Helmet
ThingDef.description: A part of powered light armor set, mostly used by light infantry.

ThingDef.label: Doom Helmet
ThingDef.description: The helmet part of power armor set. It is mostly used by heavy infantry.

ThingDef.label: Power Armor Helmet
ThingDef.description: The helmet part of power armor set. It is mostly used by heavy infantry.

ThingDef.label: Buckler
ThingDef.description: A shield made from hard materials able to deflect most types of attack. Wears out with use.

ThingDef.label: Medieval Shield
ThingDef.description: A shield made from metallic and able to deflect most types of attack. Wears out with use.

ThingDef.label: Ballistic shield
ThingDef.description: Ballistic shields are shields specifically designed to defeat handgun, long gun, and shotgun projectile threats, many will additionally defeat most types of stabbing or cutting-type weaponry, and hand-thrown or launched projectiles such as rocks and arrows. Pawn with higher combat skills will use ballistic shield more efficiently. Wears out with use.
